[{"id":"dev-17221","entityId":"86-22721","jiraId":null,"field":[{"name":"projectShortName","value":"dev"},{"name":"summary","value":"[Alter Booking] Translations are missing"},{"name":"reporterFullName","value":"Maksym Hopei"},{"name":"created","value":"1580460163016"},{"name":"numberInProject","value":"17221"},{"name":"description","value":"

|URL|https://www.regiondo.de/resellers/account/|

Steps to reproduce:

  1. Go to a booking view page in a reseller dashboard (non-EN language)
  2. Open "Alter Booking" tab
  3. Check the texts

Actual result:

Some texts are in English.

Expected result:

All texts have to be in the respective language.

"},{"name":"updaterFullName","value":"Alexander Bechte"},{"name":"reporterName","value":"m.hopei"},{"name":"commentsCount","value":"2"},{"name":"updaterName","value":"alexander.bechte"},{"name":"markdown","value":"true"},{"name":"wikified","value":"true"},{"name":"votes","value":"0"},{"name":"updated","value":"1580731309828"},{"name":"When is it needed ?","value":["Normal"],"valueId":["Normal"],"color":{"bg":"#e6f6cf","fg":"#4da400"}},{"name":"Type","value":["Bug"],"valueId":["Bug"],"color":null},{"name":"State","value":["Feedback"],"valueId":["Feedback"],"color":{"bg":"#ff7123","fg":"#fff"}},{"name":"Reproducible","value":["Yes"],"valueId":["Yes"],"color":null},{"name":"Assignee","value":[{"value":"m.hopei","fullName":"Maksym Hopei"}]},{"name":"sprint","value":[{"value":"First sprint","id":"Team Z:First sprint"}]},{"name":"attachments","value":[{"value":"image.png","id":"89-66082","url":"https://track.regiondo.com/_persistent/image.png?file=89-66082&c=true"}]}],"comment":[{"id":"88-65385","author":"m.hopei","authorFullName":"Maksym Hopei","issueId":"dev-17221","parentId":null,"deleted":false,"jiraId":null,"text":"

Dear @Alexander Bechte, please provide me with the translations for the following lines for Alter Booking functionality:

  • Booking changed
  • Booking changed (Items)
  • Assign participants to a new price category for the new offer
  • Old
  • Previous total
  • New total
  • Please choose non-zero quantity for each option
","shownForIssueAuthor":false,"created":1580722665781,"updated":0,"permittedGroup":null,"markdown":true,"replies":[]},{"id":"88-65388","author":"alexander.bechte","authorFullName":"Alexander Bechte","issueId":"dev-17221","parentId":null,"deleted":false,"jiraId":null,"text":"
Hi Maksym Hopei - sure.

Here you find the translation - will be done end of today:
https://jsmdg-my.sharepoint.com/:x:/g/personal/alexander_bechte_regiondo_com/ETCwDqqwgm1GisKLOgLNoTQBG8wb-inSzjdtaAM3KIV6dA?e=d9JExi
","shownForIssueAuthor":false,"created":1580723705985,"updated":0,"permittedGroup":null,"markdown":false,"replies":[]}],"tag":[]}, {"id":"dev-16123","entityId":"86-19515","jiraId":null,"field":[{"name":"projectShortName","value":"dev"},{"name":"summary","value":"[Booking widget] No upcoming date available"},{"name":"reporterFullName","value":"Yann Maurer"},{"name":"created","value":"1554729590703"},{"name":"numberInProject","value":"16123"},{"name":"description","value":"
URLhttps://hirsch-sprung.regiondo.de/mtb-fahrtechniktraining-in-kirchzarten
Product ID70480
Account emailbjoern.fuenfgeld@hirsch-sprung.com

Steps to reproduce:

  1. Pick an offer with not much appointments in the future, e.g. https://hirsch-sprung.regiondo.de/mtb-fahrtechniktraining-in-kirchzarten
  2. go to future month

Actual result:

User clicks on next months hoping to find an appointment

November

December

etc.

Expected result:

Explain to the user that there are no more appointments bookable online

Copy

EN
Sorry, there is no online availability starting from June 2023.
Please call us at XXX.

FR
Désolé, il n'y a pas de disponibilité en ligne à partir de juin 2023.
Veuillez nous appeler au XXX.

DE
Es gibt leider keine Online-Verfügbarkeit ab Juni 2023.
Bitte rufen Sie uns an unter XXX.

"},{"name":"updaterFullName","value":"Maksym Hopei"},{"name":"reporterName","value":"y.maurer"},{"name":"commentsCount","value":"4"},{"name":"updaterName","value":"m.hopei"},{"name":"markdown","value":"true"},{"name":"wikified","value":"true"},{"name":"votes","value":"0"},{"name":"updated","value":"1580724654198"},{"name":"links","value":[{"value":"dev-14645","type":"Subtask","role":"subtask of"}]},{"name":"When is it needed ?","value":["Normal"],"valueId":["Normal"],"color":{"bg":"#e6f6cf","fg":"#4da400"}},{"name":"Type","value":["Usability Problem"],"valueId":["Usability Problem"],"color":null},{"name":"State","value":["In Progress"],"valueId":["In Progress"],"color":{"bg":"#0070e4","fg":"#fff"}},{"name":"Reproducible","value":["Yes"],"valueId":["Yes"],"color":null},{"name":"Assignee","value":[{"value":"m.hopei","fullName":"Maksym Hopei"}]},{"name":"Spent time","value":["42"],"valueId":["42m"],"color":null},{"name":"sprint","value":[{"value":"First sprint","id":"Team Z:First sprint"}]},{"name":"attachments","value":[{"value":"image.png","id":"89-55825","url":"https://track.regiondo.com/_persistent/image.png?file=89-55825&c=true"},{"value":"image1.png","id":"89-55826","url":"https://track.regiondo.com/_persistent/image1.png?file=89-55826&c=true"},{"value":"image2.png","id":"89-55827","url":"https://track.regiondo.com/_persistent/image2.png?file=89-55827&c=true"},{"value":"16123 No Upcoming Date Available V05.png","id":"89-59846","url":"https://track.regiondo.com/_persistent/16123%20No%20Upcoming%20Date%20Available%20V05.png?file=89-59846&c=true"},{"value":"16123 [Booking widget] No upcoming date available.sketch","id":"89-59847","url":"https://track.regiondo.com/_persistent/16123%20%5BBooking%20widget%5D%20No%20upcoming%20date%20available.sketch?file=89-59847&c=true"}]}],"comment":[{"id":"88-60004","author":"a.bugaichuk","authorFullName":"Andrii Bugaichuk","issueId":"dev-16123","parentId":null,"deleted":false,"jiraId":null,"text":"

@Yann Maurer

  1. For me text "Sorry, there is no online availability for June 2023." does not correspond to the requirement "there are no more appointments bookable online". The word "for" in the message means exactely the same that empty calendar for the current month and gives no additional information about the future availability. Probably we should use something like "Sorry, there is no online availability starting from June 2023."
  2. Should we fix the behavior when "Time" line and quantity selector remain when customer switches to month without any appointment?
  3. How to open 16123 [Booking widget] No upcoming date available (1).sketch attachment?

P.S. For such cases we should suggest to client to not use calendar representation but drop-down or disable possibility to select it on preview phase with some explanation.

","shownForIssueAuthor":false,"created":1563353290218,"updated":0,"permittedGroup":null,"markdown":true,"replies":[]},{"id":"88-60009","author":"g.horvath","authorFullName":"György Horváth","issueId":"dev-16123","parentId":null,"deleted":false,"jiraId":null,"text":"

@Andrii Bugaichuk
1.) Agree, if we don't have any appointment later.
2.) I would agree, it would look better, but I think it's unnecessary dev cost. Our users probably won't get to see it. As they would stop reading/looking at the phone number.
3.) Open the png file or download the app here: https://www.sketch.com/. Or please use the following. Text= Roboto, 19, Bold. Border size = size of the calendar. Border color: color of past days.

","shownForIssueAuthor":false,"created":1563355697224,"updated":1563355936904,"permittedGroup":null,"markdown":true,"replies":[]},{"id":"88-60059","author":"y.maurer","authorFullName":"Yann Maurer","issueId":"dev-16123","parentId":null,"deleted":false,"jiraId":null,"text":"

@Andrii Bugaichuk
The reality is that often supplier pre-fill appointments for a longer period of time (eventually 12 months) but forget to populate new availbilites when the end of the season approaches, so suggesting a drop-down would not help

","shownForIssueAuthor":false,"created":1563382138879,"updated":0,"permittedGroup":null,"markdown":true,"replies":[]},{"id":"88-65292","author":"sergey.chorny","authorFullName":"Sergey Chorny","issueId":"dev-16123","parentId":null,"deleted":false,"jiraId":null,"text":"

@Maksym Hopei
Please take a look if it is possible to return me last available appoinment date.

","shownForIssueAuthor":false,"created":1580222974421,"updated":0,"permittedGroup":null,"markdown":true,"replies":[]}],"tag":[]}, {"id":"dev-16565","entityId":"86-20953","jiraId":null,"field":[{"name":"projectShortName","value":"dev"},{"name":"summary","value":"[Ticketshop] [Bundle offer] Availability for second offer not showing completely when period falls on a change of months"},{"name":"reporterFullName","value":"Aline Morgenstern"},{"name":"created","value":"1564996188106"},{"name":"numberInProject","value":"16565"},{"name":"description","value":"
URLhttps://themorningstarcompany.regiondo.com/xxx
Product ID85986
Account emailaline.morgenstern@regiondo.com
Supplier ID21511
novomind ticket62445
EnvironmentWindows 10, Chrome Version 75.0.3770.142

Steps to reproduce:

  1. Login to dashboard with aline.morgenstern@regiondo.com

  2. Go to Manage offers > My offer bundles and click on "Bundle offer" (product ID 85986).

  3. Go to step 3 tickets and set the point "Activities should start taking place within" to e.g. 14 days.

  4. Save and publish offer and open it in ticketshop: https://themorningstarcompany.regiondo.com/xxx

  5. Choose a day and time for the first offer where less than 14 days are left until the end of the month, e.g. 26th August, 8 a.m.

Actual result:

For the second offer, only the days 26th to 31st of August are shown for selection, which is within 6 days of the date that has been selected for the first offer. The remaining 8 days that were set up as availability in the offer creation, do not show up --> The period of 14 days that was set in the offer creation is not fully shown due to switch of calendar months.

The same thing happens when minutes or hours is used in the offer creation process.

Offer Sternenregen in Sternstadt Availability

Offer STADIUM TOUR

Expected result:

Even when there is a change of months, the availability should be completely displayed as was set in offer creation.

ng?file=89-65028&c=true"},{"value":"image1576846391738.png","id":"89-65285","url":"https://track.regiondo.com/_persistent/image1576846391738.png?file=89-65285&c=true"},{"value":"image1576848271489.png","id":"89-65289","url":"https://track.regiondo.com/_persistent/image1576848271489.png?file=89-65289&c=true"},{"value":"image1576848496102.png","id":"89-65290","url":"https://track.regiondo.com/_persistent/image1576848496102.png?file=89-65290&c=true"},{"value":"image1578997430674.png","id":"89-65719","url":"https://track.regiondo.com/_persistent/image1578997430674.png?file=89-65719&c=true"},{"value":"Recurring ","shownForIssueAuthor":false,"created":1569411640118,"updated":0,"permittedGroup":null,"markdown":true,"replies":[]},{"id":"88-62870","author":"Bogdan_Cumpanasu","authorFullName":"Bogdan Cumpanasu","issueId":"dev-16565","parentId":null,"deleted":false,"jiraId":null,"text":"

Checked on testing with demoaccount@regiondo.de
Edited the offer id 55770 and went to step 3 tickets, set the point "Activities should start taking place within" to 14 days and selected option stating that the 'Customer is free to choose the sequence of activities':

Chose the first activity to be on the 26th of November 2019, at 08:00. The issue is that for the 2nd product within the bundle the period of 14 days that was set in the offer creation is not fully shown

","shownForIssueAuthor":false,"created":1571986473927,"updated":0,"permittedGroup":null,"markdown":true,"replies":[]},{"id":"88-62984","author":"Dmitry_Shitikov","authorFullName":"Dmitry Shitikov","issueId":"dev-16565","parentId":null,"deleted":false,"jiraId":null,"text":"

","shownForIssueAuthor":false,"created":1572367790524,"updated":0,"permittedGroup":null,"markdown":true,"replies":[]},{"id":"88-63039","author":"Dmitry_Shitikov","authorFullName":"Dmitry Shitikov","issueId":"dev-16565","parentId":null,"deleted":false,"jiraId":null,"text":"

@Bogdan Cumpanasu please check on testing, please attend to vacation option on specific offers in bundle. Also I've fixed bug with penult day of month when user choose 30 of october for first component, and app automatically force hide calendar and not allow to choose next month.

","shownForIssueAuthor":false,"created":1572517451668,"updated":0,"permittedGroup":null,"markdown":true,"replies":[]},{"id":"88-64168","author":"y.maurer","authorFullName":"Yann Maurer","issueId":"dev-16565","parentId":null,"deleted":false,"jiraId":null,"text":"

@Bogdan Cumpanasu please test - this task is over a month old

","shownForIssueAuthor":false,"created":1575554964521,"updated":0,"permittedGroup":null,"markdown":true,"replies":[]},{"id":"88-64222","author":"Bogdan_Cumpanasu","authorFullName":"Bogdan Cumpanasu","issueId":"dev-16565","parentId":null,"deleted":false,"jiraId":null,"text":"

Checked on testing with demoaccount@regiondo.de

  1. Edited the bundle id 112465 (Book it and bond) and went to step 3 tickets, set the point "Activities should start taking place within" to 14 days and selected option stating that the 'Customer selects start time for each activity (customer only selects first activity start time per default)':

    Chose the first activity to be on the 26th of December 2019. For the 2nd product we have the availability set up for the 14 days even if it's prolonged for the next month too ✓

  2. Edited the same bundle and went to step 3 tickets, set the point "Activities should start taking place within" to 14 days and selected option stating that the 'Customer is free to choose the sequence of activities'

    I'm able to select which one will start first and the 14 days are added accordingly to the selection, regardless of which activity I select to start first, even if it's prolonged for the next month too ✓

  3. Edited the same bundle and only went to step 3 tickets to set the point "Activities should start taking place within" to 14 days

    The first added product in the bundle is displayed first and after selecting the date of participation for this one, for the 2nd one the date is the same as for the 1st one, or it's the closest in the future. Correct behavior ✓

","shownForIssueAuthor":false,"created":1575643989714,"updated":0,"permittedGroup":null,"markdown":true,"replies":[]},{"id":"88-64230","author":"Dmitry_Shitikov","authorFullName":"Dmitry Shitikov","issueId":"dev-16565","parentId":null,"deleted":false,"jiraId":null,"text":"

@Bogdan Cumpanasu you can check on stagin

","shownForIssueAuthor":false,"created":1575647711271,"updated":0,"permittedGroup":null,"markdown":true,"replies":[]},{"id":"88-64339","author":"Bogdan_Cumpanasu","authorFullName":"Bogdan Cumpanasu","issueId":"dev-16565","parentId":null,"deleted":false,"jiraId":null,"text":"

Checked on staging with demoaccount@regiondo.de
Edited the bundle id 24303 (Same product - Friends pack) that has 3 products and went to 'step 3 tickets', set the point "Activities should start taking place within" to 14 days and selected option stating that the 'Customer selects start time for each activity (customer only selects first activity start time per default)':

Chose the first activity to be on the 26th of December 2019. For the 2nd product we have the availability set up for the 14 days even if it's prolonged for the next month too ✓

Issues

  1. Wording - the phrase 'Activities should start taking place within BUNDLE_PARAM_WITHIN_DAYS_START' should be 'Activities should start taking place within'
  2. Availability shown for the 3rd product isn't fully shown (it misses the part from the next month where we should have availability until the 8th of January 2020):
  • this is the availability for the 3rd product present in the bundle (id 23939 - 'English Offer')
  • this is the availability shown when selecting the 3rd product from the bundle where the availability is missing for the 3rd product, in January (for the 2nd one we have the right availability)
","shownForIssueAuthor":false,"created":1576052216990,"updated":1576052263786,"permittedGroup":null,"markdown":true,"replies":[]},{"id":"88-64482","author":"Dmitry_Shitikov","authorFullName":"Dmitry Shitikov","issueId":"dev-16565","parentId":null,"deleted":false,"jiraId":null,"text":"

Bug happens in this condition app/code/local/Regiondo/Product/Model/Bundle/Pricelist.php:238
steps to reproduce

  1. Open product view page with three components bundle
  2. Choose for first and second components dates and times
  3. Switch to next month third component
    If choose for second component same month as for third component then exception not throws.
    So I think need to improove condition app/code/local/Regiondo/Product/Model/Bundle/Pricelist.php:238
    or move to outside of this loop and validate.
","shownForIssueAuthor":false,"created":1576254809724,"updated":1576254833065,"permittedGroup":null,"markdown":true,"replies":[]},{"id":"88-64667","author":"m.hopei","authorFullName":"Maksym Hopei","issueId":"dev-16565","parentId":null,"deleted":false,"jiraId":null,"text":"

@Bogdan Cumpanasu, fix deployed to testing and staging, please re-check the latest issue.

Fix: https://bitbucket.jsmd-group.com/projects/RGDO/repos/magento-app-src/commits/960043b19c55d90c6b337e05e6b5b487a84c7a3d

","shownForIssueAuthor":false,"created":1576836919900,"updated":1576836937907,"permittedGroup":null,"markdown":true,"replies":[]},{"id":"88-64671","author":"Bogdan_Cumpanasu","authorFullName":"Bogdan Cumpanasu","issueId":"dev-16565","parentId":null,"deleted":false,"jiraId":null,"text":"

Checked on staging with demoaccount@regiondo.de

  1. Edited the bundle id 24303 (Same product - Friends pack) that has 3 products and went to 'step 3 tickets', set the point "Activities should start taking place within" to 14 days and selected option stating that the 'Customer selects start time for each activity (customer only selects first activity start time per default)':


Chose the first activity to be on the 26th of December 2019. For the 2nd product we have the availability set up for the 14 days even if it's prolonged for the next month too ✓
Previous issue regarding availability shown for the 3rd product was fixed ✓

Issue with wording was fixed too ✓

  1. Edited the bundle id 24303 (Same product - Friends pack) that has 3 products and went to 'step 3 tickets', set the point "Activities should start taking place within" to 14 days and selected options stating that the 'Customer is free to choose the sequence of activities' and 'Customer selects start time for each activity (customer only selects first activity start time per default)':

    Correct functionality - able to interchange the products, while the availability is taken into account every time ✓
","shownForIssueAuthor":false,"created":1576848556945,"updated":0,"permittedGroup":null,"markdown":true,"replies":[]},{"id":"88-64968","author":"a.morgenstern","authorFullName":"Aline Morgenstern","issueId":"dev-16565","parentId":null,"deleted":false,"jiraId":null,"text":"

@Maksym Hopei
Tested on live with aline.morgenstern@regiondo.com

  • Works for offers with fixed opening hours ✔
  • Doesn't work for offers with set to recurring appointments ✖

Adjusted offer 85986 and connected the two products 130997 and 131007. Both offers have recurring appointments.
Actual result: last day of the month is not shown in calendar for first offer

","shownForIssueAuthor":false,"created":1578997580799,"updated":1579014267230,"permittedGroup":null,"markdown":true,"replies":[]},{"id":"88-64975","author":"a.morgenstern","authorFullName":"Aline Morgenstern","issueId":"dev-16565","parentId":null,"deleted":false,"jiraId":null,"text":"

Tested this again to give a workaround to customer but now I also cant make it work for fixed opening hours with the offers of supplier. Will check and give feedback.

","shownForIssueAuthor":false,"created":1579002856390,"updated":0,"permittedGroup":null,"markdown":true,"replies":[]},{"id":"88-65000","author":"Bogdan_Cumpanasu","authorFullName":"Bogdan Cumpanasu","issueId":"dev-16565","parentId":null,"deleted":false,"jiraId":null,"text":"

Checked on live with demoaccount@regiondo.de
Checked with bundle called 'Same product - Friends pack' (id 122867) - it has 4 products (all 4 have recurring appointments - 122862) - the days are shown accordingly (attached screencast called 'Recurring - all good) - It seems the functionality is working ✓

  1. Edited the same bundle id 122867 (Same product - Friends pack) that has 4 products and went to 'step 3 tickets', set the point "Activities should start taking place within" to 14 days and selected option stating that the 'Customer selects start time for each activity (customer only selects first activity start time per default)':

    Chose the first activity to be on the 26th of January 2020. For the 2nd product we have the availability set up for the 14 days even if it's prolonged for the next month too ✓

  2. Edited the same bundle id 122867 (Same product - Friends pack) that has 4 products and went to 'step 3 tickets', set the point "Activities should start taking place within" to 14 days and selected options stating that the 'Customer is free to choose the sequence of activities' and 'Customer selects start time for each activity (customer only selects first activity start time per default)':

    Correct functionality - able to interchange the products, while the availability is taken into account every time ✓ - attached screencast called 'Correct functionality'

@Aline Morgenstern - I checked also the bundle from account aline.morgenstern@regiondo.com and I found an issue with the product itself: when trying to edit the bundle, it says 'Some bundle components are not available anymore and were disconnected from the bundle. Probably their sale period ended or they have manual confirmation or were removed':

But the URL takes us to the bundle page and, indeed, we have the last day of the month not shown:

","shownForIssueAuthor":false,"created":1579594141238,"updated":0,"permittedGroup":null,"markdown":true,"replies":[]}],"tag":[]}, {"id":"dev-17091","entityId":"86-22404","jiraId":null,"field":[{"name":"projectShortName","value":"dev"},{"name":"summary","value":"[Cross-domain][Cookie][Iframe] Get Ready for New SameSite=None; Secure Cookie Settings"},{"name":"reporterFullName","value":"Denys Bulakh"},{"name":"created","value":"1576834548888"},{"name":"numberInProject","value":"17091"},{"name":"description","value":"

Please investigate how does it affect Regiondo Iframe integrations.

Google Chrome 80, which is scheduled by Google to be released in February 2020, changes the default behavior of cookies in cross-domain scenarios. Chrome 80 introduces a new default value for cookie attribute: “SameSite=Lax”. (Previously, the SameSite cookie attribute defaulted to “SameSite=None”.)

https://blog.chromium.org/2019/10/developers-get-ready-for-new.html

"},{"name":"updaterFullName","value":"Maksym Hopei"},{"name":"reporterName","value":"d.bulakh"},{"name":"commentsCount","value":"8"},{"name":"updaterName","value":"m.hopei"},{"name":"markdown","value":"true"},{"name":"wikified","value":"true"},{"name":"votes","value":"0"},{"name":"updated","value":"1580383640549"},{"name":"links","value":[{"value":"dev-17191","type":"Relates","role":"relates to"},{"value":"dev-17216","type":"Relates","role":"relates to"},{"value":"dev-14645","type":"Relates","role":"relates to"},{"value":"dev-17128","type":"Subtask","role":"parent for"}]},{"name":"When is it needed ?","value":["Major"],"valueId":["Major"],"color":{"bg":"#ffee9c","fg":"#b45f06"}},{"name":"Type","value":["Task"],"valueId":["Task"],"color":null},{"name":"State","value":["Finished - On Live"],"valueId":["Finished - On Live"],"color":{"bg":"#246512","fg":"#fff"}},{"name":"Reproducible","value":["Yes"],"valueId":["Yes"],"color":null},{"name":"Account Segment","value":["All"],"valueId":["All"],"color":null},{"name":"Assignee","value":[{"value":"m.hopei","fullName":"Maksym Hopei"}]},{"name":"Git Branch Name","value":["dev-17091"],"valueId":["dev-17091"],"color":null},{"name":"sprint","value":[{"value":"First sprint","id":"Team Z:First sprint"}]},{"name":"attachments","value":[{"value":"image.png","id":"89-65282","url":"https://track.regiondo.com/_persistent/image.png?file=89-65282&c=true"}]}],"comment":[{"id":"88-64666","author":"d.bulakh","authorFullName":"Denys Bulakh","issueId":"dev-17091","parentId":null,"deleted":false,"jiraId":null,"text":"

@Maksym Hopei, please investigate this together with @Sergey Chorny, we need to understand which problems would we have in February 2020 with our iframe integrations. Thanks

","shownForIssueAuthor":false,"created":1576834671924,"updated":0,"permittedGroup":null,"markdown":true,"replies":[]},{"id":"88-64700","author":"m.hopei","authorFullName":"Maksym Hopei","issueId":"dev-17091","parentId":null,"deleted":false,"jiraId":null,"text":"

In a nutshell: Starting from February 2020 all cookies without explicitly set SameSite attribute will be treated as if they have SameSite=Lax. This will prevent cookies from being used in a cross-domain communication. To overcome this the cookie must have SameSite flag set to None (a newly introduced value) and a Secure flag present.

Required actions:

  • Compile a complete list of cookies used at Regiondo systems. Indicate the following information:
    • Name of the cookie
    • Example value or value type description
    • Domain / path used for the cookie
    • Expiration policy
    • is HttpOnly flag set?
    • is Secure flag set?
    • is used in a cross-domain communication
  • Set the SameSite=None; Secure flags to the cookies that are used in cross-domain communication. The following should be taken in consideration:
    • PHP supports SameSite flag starting from version 7.3, a workaround has to be implemented in case we are not able to upgrade before February 2020, see: https://github.com/GoogleChromeLabs/samesite-examples/blob/master/php.md.
    • There is a list of clients that don't support the None value for the SameSite flag: https://www.chromium.org/updates/same-site/incompatible-clients. The check has to be implemented on backend in order to support these clients.
  • Set the SameSite=Lax or SameSite=Strict flags on other cookies depending on exact needs explicitly, not to rely on browser default settings.

Note: To test the effect of the new Chrome behavior on your site or cookies you manage, you can go to chrome://flags in Chrome 76+ and enable the “SameSite by default cookies” and “Cookies without SameSite must be secure” experiments. (Or from Firefox 69 in about:config by setting network.cookie.sameSite.noneRequiresSecure)

","shownForIssueAuthor":false,"created":1577113190668,"updated":1577114368483,"permittedGroup":null,"markdown":true,"replies":[]},{"id":"88-64997","author":"m.hopei","authorFullName":"Maksym Hopei","issueId":"dev-17091","parentId":null,"deleted":false,"jiraId":null,"text":"
Current solution:
  • For cookies set from the backend: samesite flag is added via nginx config (delivered to testing)
  • For cookies set from javascript: samesite flag is added in respective files

Denys Bulakh, please review:
  • https://upsource.regiondo.de/infrastructure/review/INFRS-CR-4
  • https://upsource.regiondo.de/regiondo/review/RGND-CR-1794
","shownForIssueAuthor":false,"created":1579018021052,"updated":1579018146905,"permittedGroup":null,"markdown":false,"replies":[]},{"id":"88-65239","author":"m.hopei","authorFullName":"Maksym Hopei","issueId":"dev-17091","parentId":null,"deleted":false,"jiraId":null,"text":"
Naomi, Igor Dyachenko and others, please test the following:
  • Session cookies are set with SameSite=None and Secure flags.
  • Cookie-related functionality works normally (login/logout, shopping flow, etc.) (autotests).
  • iframe integrations work properly (widgets, checkout, etc. in iframe).

All tests must pass in two browser modes:
1. Default SameSite = None (current browsers behaviour until 04.02.2020)
2. Default SameSite = Lax (future browsers behaviour after 04.02.2020)

To switch browser to the second mode now:
  • Chrome 76+: go to chrome://flags and enable the “SameSite by default cookies” and “Cookies without SameSite must be secure” experiments.
  • Firefox 69: go to about:config and set network.cookie.sameSite.noneRequiresSecure to Yes
","shownForIssueAuthor":false,"created":1580117215331,"updated":0,"permittedGroup":null,"markdown":false,"replies":[]},{"id":"88-65306","author":"i.dyachenko","authorFullName":"Igor Dyachenko","issueId":"dev-17091","parentId":null,"deleted":false,"jiraId":null,"text":"

During testing on Staging with enabled "SameSite by default cookies" and "Cookies without SameSite must be secure" flags in Chrome any cookies related issues were NOT found. Let's release the functionality with one live booking acceptance test.

","shownForIssueAuthor":false,"created":1580286607413,"updated":0,"permittedGroup":null,"markdown":true,"replies":[]},{"id":"88-65328","author":"m.hopei","authorFullName":"Maksym Hopei","issueId":"dev-17091","parentId":null,"deleted":false,"jiraId":null,"text":"

@Ilya Shevyrev

Deployment steps

Additionally to normal code update please add the following instruction to Nginx configuration for Magento:

location / {
  # ...
  proxy_cookie_path / "/; SameSite=None; Secure";
}

","shownForIssueAuthor":false,"created":1580364440765,"updated":0,"permittedGroup":null,"markdown":true,"replies":[]}],"tag":[{"value":"Star","cssClass":"c0"}]}, {"id":"dev-17192","entityId":"86-22660","jiraId":null,"field":[{"name":"projectShortName","value":"dev"},{"name":"summary","value":"[POS][API] Social login with facebook and google"},{"name":"reporterFullName","value":"Viktoriia Karenko"},{"name":"created","value":"1579785912463"},{"name":"numberInProject","value":"17192"},{"name":"description","value":"

Please add possibility to login with google and facebook with new oAuth2.0.
If reseller for current email doesn't exist please return an error "Unfortunately we cannot find a Regiondo account for this email address".

Input data:

access_token=facebook/google_access_token
scope=reseller-data,
grant_type=social_login,
client_id=POS,
client_secret=client_secret

Output data:

Same as we have for normal login
